oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dug relics recovered from Col. R.D. Allison's Camp
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: R. D. Allison served in the Confederate Cavalry and often operated in conjunction with General John Hunt Morgan. Items include Enfield bullets, an 1853 half-dime, a wiper (also known as a "worm"" parts of two pocket knives, and a variety of small iron buckles from pieces of US and CS tack. All of the items were recovered from Allison's camp in Alexandria, Dekalb County, Tennessee. In the summer of 1863, Allison's Squadron joined Joe Wheeler's command and remained with him to the end of the war.
